info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 4:42PM EDT until May 31 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Gray ME
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring or expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Belknap and Merrimack. In southern New Hampshire, Hillsborough.
* WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring due to recent thunderstorms combined with continue runoff due to this morning's rain.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 442 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported road closures in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Concord, Laconia, Franklin, Henniker, Meredith, Hooksett, Peterborough, Hopkinton, New Boston and Loudon.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Belknap, NH; Hillsborough, NH; Merrimack, NH
